comment: Two ways to express "exactly one thing exists". To paraphrase the statement and explain the label: there Exists a Unique thing if and only if for All ` x ` , ` x ` Equals some given (and disjoint) ` y ` . Both sides are false in set theory, see theorems ~ neutru and ~ dtru . (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2004.) State the theorem using truth constant ` T. ` . (Revised by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.) Reduce axiom dependencies. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 2-Mar-2023.)
